issue.title: Connection table recompile can't handle missing globals file

content.raw:
Ok so I found the bug. zprocess.zmq_push_multipart calls _typecheck_or_convert_data. This function checks that all items in the list 'data' are of type bytes. However this will not be the case in python3 for all strings that don't have a bytes literal in front of them.
So the fix would be: 

```
#!python

zprocess.zmq_push_multipart(stream_port, data=[b'stderr', error.encode('utf8')])
```

Should I create a pull request over at runmanager or should we fix this in zprocess.?
